definition: (onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires

sentences.english: Tread upon them to issue Cha Cha's voice.
sentences.chinese: 踩在它们身上发出嚓嚓的声音。

sentences.english: He became aware of the deep silence of the room; there was only the steady ticking of the wall clock's pendulum.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得房间里静极了，只有挂钟的大摆在嚓嚓地响。

sentences.english: The tires sang over the highway.
sentences.chinese: 轮胎在公路上嚓嚓低吟。

sentences.english: Suddenly, at the foot of Cha Cha a cracking voice again makes me feel dead leaves their rupture.
sentences.chinese: 蓦然，脚下嚓嚓嚓的声音又使我感到枯叶们的破裂。

definition: (onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
(onom.) breaking or snapping/(coll.) cut it out/stop it/also written 喀嚓[ka1 cha1]
(onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)
(onom.) for crack, slap, clap, clatter etc
